Dialogue: Jesus Christ! D'er's too much we don't know and if you're won't at least try ta talk some sense into them, I will!

Dialogue: Game time.   How are we playing this?

Dialogue: O'kay, Eunice. I don't see why the fuck the Fed is...

Speaker: duffy
Dialogue: What is the Fed's interest in this? The detectives harden, brick wall.     Eunice furrows her brow.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Their interest, Detective, is capturing the men responsible for the murders of 22 of Boston's finest criminals. Y'see public perception is that these boys stepped in, did our jobs for us and then disappeared into thin air as we fecklessly searched for them. The FBI tends to take exception to such things. They coulda sent anyone. They sent me. Why do you think that is?

EUNICE  It is because I am so fucking smart that I make smart people feel like retards. Now, we seem to be getting off on the wrong foot here. I'd appreciate a bit of cooperation. Let's chalk it up to paying respect to the memory of a dearly departed mutual friend. A man who taught me everything I know.

Dialogue: The victim was killed late last night. When people gathered for morning mass, they found the front entrance chained and padlocked. A locksmith came out, cut the chain and surprise, surprise. Cell phones. Half of them called the cops. Half of them called the media. But regardless...word's out.

Dialogue: And it looks like that's just the way somebody wanted it. What say we scrape the shit off this cow's ass, fellas? Detective Greenly? Escort a lady onto the crime scene?

Dialogue: What?   No, yeah, no.   Of course.

Dialogue: All their vics were criminals. Clearly not the case here. So, it wasn't them which means this is a local matter and it falls under our jurisdiction. No need for Federal involvement so with all due respect...we'll see you later, Special Agent Bloom.

Dialogue: Man, I hate it when people say that. "With all due respect." Because it is inevitably followed by a disrespectful remark. I'll give you an example. With all due respect, Detective, this matter falls under whatever jurisdiction I fuckin' say it does.

Dialogue: What are you, fucking five years old?

Dialogue: Hey, Rome, we got sheets and broomsticks. You could build yourself a fort.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Fuck the both of you!

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: Not this time, ya little shit.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: We'll see, old man.

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: FUCK!

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: ...me up the...

Speaker: doc
Dialogue: ASS! The boys and Romeo burst into hysterics.   Doc rages.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Oh, yeah.     Someone's been eating their Wheaties.     Yeah, get after it, girl.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: What did you just call me?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Why, I'm a lady, George. That fact alone demands a certain amount of...  ...cordiality.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: I'm, I'm sorry I called you that.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Well, how courteous of you to apologize. Courtesy is so important. Don't you agree?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Y, yeah...I'm with that.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Good.   Now sit your fat ass down.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Yeah. There's a lot of stuff you don't know, Hoss. For instance, why aren't you safely tucked away in some ivory tower with all the other big wigs, sucking on cannoli and shrimp cocktail? Why are you the one he left on the streets, George?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Someone's gotta run our legitimate businesses. Someone's gotta make sure that...

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Someone's gotta chum the waters.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: That's bullshit and I ain't saying another fucking word to you.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Good. Then you can just listen. The jig is up. We know Concezio had that priest killed.
EUNICE  By the by, you got a pretty nice ass for a fat man.

Speaker: cesar
Dialogue: Word is, Yakavetta's gunning for you boys hard. The whole city's on edge. I even heard he posted a reward like Jesse James style and shit. Any of his guys that take you out gets his palm crossed, two hundred and fifty grand.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Whew.   A quarter of a mill for us?

Speaker: cesar
Dialogue: Us? What the fuck are you talking about "us?"

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Uncle, why do you have to disrespect me in front of them?!

Speaker: cesar
Dialogue: Cool it, Mr. Big Shot! A year ago you were washing my pots and pans!

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Well, I don't wash fucking pots anymore! I'm part of this, Uncle!

Speaker: cesar
Dialogue: Hey! This isn't my first bar-b-que! Now shut up and stop interrupting! Let me talk to them and I'll figure out whether your in on this or in your own fucking fantasy world!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: He's in.   All the way in.

Speaker: cesar
Dialogue: Is my nephew pulling his weight?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Mucho corazon.

Speaker: cesar
Dialogue: Gorgeous George is running the show for Little Yaka. Drugs, prostitution, sharking, the whole cha cha. If anybody knows where he is, it's that fat fucking pedico. I'll put it out on the wire.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Hey, uh, maybe we should...

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Shut up.   Romeo's crying.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: You fucking assholes!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Oh! Like the Roman Empire in here! Where's all the concubines and shit?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: I need to see the Boss, right away.

Speaker: concezio
Dialogue: Get over here!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Whoa!

Speaker: concezio
Dialogue: Push the talk button, numb nuts.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Oh.  Can you here me? Over.

Speaker: concezio
Dialogue: I can hear you fine, Smokey and the Bandit. Now, what the fuck are you doing here?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Everything's in motion. All our guys are gunning for these Jesus Freaks. I figure, no need for me to be on the streets no more. So, which room do I take, eh?

Speaker: concezio
Dialogue: You stupid motherfucker! I told you, you're on the streets till this is over! Now get the fuck outta here!

Speaker: jo jo
Dialogue: A priest.   The sick fuck.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: And he leaves all of us on the streets holding the bag while him and his are living it up at the Taj fuckin' Majal, not a care in the world.

Speaker: jo jo
Dialogue: So, until the Saints get popped, we're all lambs to slaughter?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Yeah! And he don't care how many of us they wipe out in the meantime!

Speaker: jo jo
Dialogue: What do you need me to do, Skipper?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Spread the word to all the brugliones. No bullshit. From your mouth to their ears.

Speaker: jo jo
Dialogue: Everyone? North and South?   That could get a little dicey.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Fuck their old grudges. All of them are in this, like it or not. Tell them everything we discussed.

Speaker: jo jo
Dialogue: Even the panic room thing?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: jo jo
Dialogue: Good. That's a nice ice breaker. They'll get a kick outta that. I didn't even know those things were real. I thought they made that shit up for that movie? With that brawd and that kid? With those guys in that house?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Panic Room?

Speaker: jo jo
Dialogue: Naw, the other one.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Stop fuckin' around! This is serious shit, here! Tell 'em we meet tomorrow night. I'll call you with the location.

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: Tap's up and running on George's cell.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: What's this?

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: Rosary bead. They found it pushed into the carpet near the victim. Father McKinney wasn't wearing a rosary so it's probably been there a while. Duffy comes in with a stack of papers.   He heaves it down.

Speaker: duffy
Dialogue: The results on all 864 prints found at the scene. All match churchgoers or clergy but one. The partial on the priest's watch is still unidentified.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: That's horse shit. Everyone gets printed nowadays. They're inking up snotgobblers in kindergarten, now.

Speaker: dolly
Dialogue: It's a brick wall anyway. We know Napoleon was wearing gloves. Lab got zilch off the chain and lock. The pennies came up clean too.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: I'm gonna go powder my nose.

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: Aw, man. Daddy would knock that out like Mike Tyson.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: McKinney wore his watch on his left hand.

Speaker: duffy
Dialogue: Right here, off his left elbow.   Where are you going with this?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Dolly, get on the phone! Find out which wrist he wore his rosary on and if he was wearing it that night! Duffy, run that partial through DMV! David put it through INTERpol! Just get an I.D.! Now! Come on! Vamoose!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What the...did they use his mug shot?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: What?   No.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: You remember how he told us he was embarrassed cuz the guy had to hold up all his long hair behind his head?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Aye.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Look at that.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Oh...that's fuckin' harsh.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Y'er one of a kind, Roc.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: So, am I as good as this guy, or what?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: You, sir, are no David Della Rocco.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: Whoa!  Whoa! Whoa! Holy shit!  HOLY SHIT! You're the Saints! I'm Roy, it's an honor. Huge fan!

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: We're developin' quite the cult following in the old neighborhood.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Que pasa.

Speaker: cesar
Dialogue: I got that info you wanted, mijo.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: We got him.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: Pleased to meet you. I'm Roy.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: How would you like me to sidekick you in the ass, Roy?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Let's go.

Speaker: roy
Dialogue: I, I didn't mean to...

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: I'm sick of this shit! I've been breaking my balls, here and I get second banana billing! I...

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I, I, I. There is no "I" in team, ya selfish prick.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Yeah?!   Well, there's an "I" in "Fuck you!

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Lovely voice. We'd like ya ta sing for us. What do ya say? George struggles and nods. Murphy hops off. George spills out, hot pink Speedos. On all fours and breathing heavy...

Speaker: george
Dialogue: It's getting hard to be a fucking gentleman of leisure, here!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We want the shooter you motherfuckers used on that priest.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: I don't know who it is.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Where's Yakavetta hidin'?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: The Prudential! Fortieth floor!   Jesus Christ!

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: You meeting someone tonight, George?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Yeah.   The brugliones.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: The what?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Yakavetta's racket chiefs. Street guys.  Your kind of guys. You could take a real bite outta crime here, huh? I could help you.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: What's this?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Nobody forgot what you guys did to us last time. They're staying indoors. I give out the location an hour before.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: My Uncle's place is closed tonight.    I got the key.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It's down by the docks.   Dead as a doornail at night.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Yeah. You could set off fourth of July fireworks in dat place and nobody would hear. How's Mexican for you, George?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: No difference to me. I think I just shit my Speedos, anyway.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: How do, David?

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: Hey, DMV came up dry on the partial. INTERpol's still working it. Should only be another couple of hours.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Lovely.   Anything else?

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: Yeah. Nothing big. We just dumped a text message from George's cell. Just two words. "El Cava." It's a Mexican joint down by the docks. He sent it to his enforcer, Jo Jo Rhama. Guess gangsters gotta eat too, huh?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: I think I'll drop in on their supper, see if I can shake them up a little.

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: You need a body guard?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: No thank you, Mike Tyson.    Bye now.

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: Bye.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Just two more to go. Uh...You guys are gonna let me go, right?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We'll see, won't we.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Jesus, this is some embarrassing shit.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Si, muchachos.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: These dagos are getting antsy and I'm getting Spicaroo'd and Pepe'd. The kid's about to go Poncho fucking Villa out there!

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Stick it out. Waitin' on one more.

Speaker: crew cut
Dialogue: He is not with them.

Speaker: old man
Dialogue: Are you certain?

Speaker: crew cut
Dialogue: Yes. It is only the sons. They have a Spaniard with them. They will slaughter everyone.

Speaker: old man
Dialogue: Let them. If you kill the sons...the father will come.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: The gang's all here.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Gimme my fucking bee bee gun.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Naw.   You've earned your stripes, Rome.

Speaker: jo jo
Dialogue: So....where's Gorgeous?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It's Irish for "You're fucked."

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Viva La Mejico, bitches!

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Uh, I've seen the light! You guys have really turned me around on this! I'm like born again and shit! I swear!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What do ya think? Let him go?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: We'll let God decide if you get a second chance.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Now, that was, perhaps the finest example of spiritual guidance that I have ever had the good fortune ta witness.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Well, thank you very much.     Mysterious ways. Mysterious ways.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Easy fellas. I'm alone.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: He's gone.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Who are ya?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: My name is Eunice Bloom...and I'm your new guardian angel. A torch was passed to me by a mutual friend, gone but not forgotten.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We heard about Smecker.    He was a good man.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Aye.   You have our condolences.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: And you have mine.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Murphy.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Very well...Connor, Murphy.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Who the fuck was that guy?!

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: That, I suspect, was the shooter you boys have been looking for.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Fucking...what the fuck?! Who the fuck is this brawd?! And what the fuck's going on, here?!

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Let's speed this up before your new sidekick's got to dig any deeper into his impressive vocabulary.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Oh, no you didn't.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: I am an FBI agent who is controlling this investigation from within, in order to ensure that you gentlemen never see the inside of a prison cell. I am conspiring to do this with three like minded individuals who have aided you in the past. Though I have yet to inform them of my agenda because, well, girl's gotta have her fun.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Dolly, Duffy and Greenly?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: The very same.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: How are the lads?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Two of them are scared.   One's just horny.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Bet'cha I can guess which one.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Bet'cha can but let's save it for group. Right now, we have a big problem.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: This...simply won't do. We made a deal. The big fish step in if your body count gets too high and...  ...you have been very naughty boys.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: O'kay.   Here's how it all went down.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: A secret gathering of the Brugliones. The topic of discussion? Weak leadership and betrayal.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: The enemy of my enemy is my friend. So, even with all their old vendettas...

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: And there it is. Guess what comes next.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Ah. Easier uttered than accomplished. The North End and the South End may as well be the Hetfields and the McCoys. These fellas...they just don't get on.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Oh, the cliche. A Mexican stand off in a Mexican restaurant.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Yakavetta's lost control of the streets.
EUNICE  They're fighting over his throne.      This was not the work of the Saints.

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: INTERpol came through.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Are you ready for your fifteen minutes, Sweetheart?

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: That ain't all. Short stuff's work visa was signed by a sponsor that doesn't exist and look at the date. Two months after Nine Eleven.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Someone maneuvered it through the system using false information during the highest alert in U.S. history.

Speaker: dolly
Dialogue: Yakavetta's just a gangster. He ain't got the juice to pull that off.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: You're darn tootin' he don't.

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: INS red flagged it like a motherfucker. It's a shit storm.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Something stanks like manure.

Speaker: dolly
Dialogue: What is this? Where are we going?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: It's time to revisit the scene of the crime.

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: It's after hours. I mean, if you wanted a drink then...

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: 37 bodies later and we're finally back where it all began. Y'ever heard of the southern expression, "We have an elephant in the living room?"

Speaker: duffy
Dialogue: You knew all along.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: What?    Ya don't call.   Ya don't write.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I'm glad we got the band back together...  ...even though our new bass player's kind of a retard.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: So, where'd you learn ta shoot like that?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: My Daddy was an old six gun shooter.      A real cowboy.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Guess that makes you a cowgirl, eh? Thanks. Saved our asses.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Don't mention it. Now, we have a little business to go over before you celebrate in earnest.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: This is the guy?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: That's the guy. He's a Sicilian immigrant, name of Ottilio Panza.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Five, five?    He's short bastard isn't he?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Yes...and well put. He'll be front page news in the morning but we have to assume Yakavetta already knows we've ID'd his guy. We can't give him time to 'Plan B' us.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We're hittin' him tomorrow night.   Dat soon enough?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Should be.   Where's it gonna happen?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: The Pru.

Speaker: dolly
Dialogue: The Prudential Building?   What are you, cracked?

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: Why don't you just do it on center ice at a fucking Bruin's game?!

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Dat's where the man is so dat's where we're goin'. No guts no glory, Green Beans.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: In fact, we could use a few extra hands...that is if you fellas can still get yer Irish on.

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: Hey, I got balls for days, pally.   I'm a fucking sack-o-matic.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Well, you boys have fun. Connor, Murphy? Escort a lady to the door?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Y'sure you don't wanna hear the plan? I'm not tryin' ta brag or nothin' but this one's a real Picasso.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Aw, Jesus.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: School night. Got some homework to do. Besides, I'd like to critique your masterpiece with a fresh eye.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Something ain't right with this whole thing. Panza knew you were in there tonight and he just let it happen. Didn't lift a finger. I mean, if he's working for Yakavetta, why would he stand by and just watch all his guys get taken out?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: That is...interestin'.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: You think maybe we got another fox in the hen house here?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Starting ta look that way. Somebody pushed that visa through. Could have ourselves a gen-u-ine 'Ghost in the Darkness,' here.

Speaker: crew cut
Dialogue: They still live...What if he does not come? What if...

Speaker: old man
Dialogue: Shhhhh.   He will come.

Speaker: gun dealer
Dialogue: Expanded my operation, since I saw ya last. Word got out who may or may not have outfitted ya. Turns out ya got quite the underground followin'.

Speaker: gun dealer
Dialogue: Please, gentlemen. Preferred customers select from my private reserve.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I feel like that kid who found the gold ticket in the candy bar in "Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory."

Speaker: gun dealer
Dialogue: Charlie.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Yeah...Charlie.  And I want an Oompa Loompa now, Daddy, now.

Speaker: gun dealer
Dialogue: Full accessory packages.      I'm sure you'll find them useful.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: I'll take these.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Have you been crying again?

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Yeah!  Tears of joy!  How much?

Speaker: gun dealer
Dialogue: You guys are on the house.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Let's see.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Nothin'.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Are you saying I look gay?!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: No.    You just hail from a colorful...

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: You don't know me. You think these make me look gay? Romeo poses.    The Dealer shrugs.

Speaker: gun dealer
Dialogue: You look like you might have seen one up close.

Speaker: old man
Dialogue: Evidence?

Speaker: old man
Dialogue: Foolish, arrogant boy!   What have you done?!

Speaker: concezio
Dialogue: That wiley old fox not as clever as we thought. Or maybe he played me from the git. Y-you think he played me?

Speaker: jimmy
Dialogue: Uh, Boss. Maybe you aught not to be telling me this stuff. I'm just...

Speaker: concezio
Dialogue: A little sensitivity, huh? You heartless cocksucker! I need to vindicate my feelings here! I can't tell those goombas outside! They'll serve up my balls over a plate of fucking spaghetti!

Speaker: concezio
Dialogue: I want each of you to call your top button man. The best you got. I want them all here tonight. We rip this city a new asshole. It's time for us to reconnoiter our strength on the streets. We seize the day starting now...Carpel Tunnel, gentlemen, Carpel Tunnel.

Speaker: dolly
Dialogue: God speed. Romeo, in a laundry uniform, emerges from the back pushing a loaded laundry cart. He enters a...

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Out with it! What the hell's the matter with ya?

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Nothing! It's just...this is some heavy shit.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Ya did fine at your uncle's place.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Yeah, but we're going off a new script here. I'm just having a...period of adjustment.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: You're about to have a period of gettin' yer ass beat!

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Hey! You two ain't the only ones rollin' with no health insurance! Just let me do my thing. I'm absorbing this.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: This is not the time for you to be absorbin' shit! Now, if ya freeze up when you get in there just point yer gay guns at 'em and fer Christ sakes, at least try ta look cool!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I thought you were all hot fer dis!

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: Oh, I'm hot! I'm fucking red hot! The kid's flamin' like Matt Damon in the Grande Camens!

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: This is you. Be on time.

Speaker: romeo
Dialogue: I'll be there.

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: You ready fer dis shit, my dear brother?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Let's do some gratuitous violence.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: On a sultry Saturday in September the Saints saved seventeen souls...try saying that five times fast.

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: Come on. There's nothing to be afraid of. It's all over.   He won't come out.

Speaker: kuntsler
Dialogue: Special Agent Bloom! You are hereby relieved of all obligation to this investigation.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Just fine...Cunty.

Speaker: kuntsler
Dialogue: Nice little science project you got going with these three goofballs.  You trying to turn them into your own little junior G-men? Well, you can put sprinkles on shit, Bloom, but it's still shit. So, you and your Keystone Cops can all go home now and let the professionals handle this?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Boy. I'd love to hear a gen-u-wine professional's assessment of a crime scene. How 'bout you, detectives?

Speaker: kuntsler
Dialogue: O'kay. Seems pretty obvious. The door was broken down. We've got our point of entry. The assailants fired in this direction.
KUNTSLER  Explains the windows. The victims were...

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: There are three inaccuracies in what you just said. Number one, David.

Speaker: greenly
Dialogue: If the windows were shattered by gunfire coming from inside the room, the glass would have been blown outward. As you can see, most of it is on the inside.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Number two, Dolly.

Speaker: dolly
Dialogue: Blood splatters in the direction of the rounds fired. If the assailants discharged toward the windows, the blood would follow suit. Here, the majority of splatter is in the opposing direction.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Number three, Duffy.

Speaker: duffy
Dialogue: Trick question. There is no number three. He only fucked up twice.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Looks like Bloomy aced her science project.

Speaker: kuntsler
Dialogue: That was just off the...I would have seen the blood thing...I haven't even had time to...

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Why don't you let me take a crack at it, John? Won't cost you nuthin'.

Speaker: kuntsler
Dialogue: And just why would I do that?

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Cuz, tonight...mamma's right on time.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: This evening's topic of discussion? Desperate times require desperate measures.

Speaker: concezio
Dialogue: Desperate times require...some, you know, some desperate shit. Starting tonight, every one of you fat fucking slobs is back on the streets and earning your daily bread.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Which brings us to the relevance of our new guests.

Speaker: concezio
Dialogue: Each one of you is to stick to the guy that called you here like glue. You arm yourselves to the teeth, pick your own crews. These bible banging psychos will make an attempt. It's your job to blow their souless hearts out of their chests.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: It's time to reclaim the streets with an iron fist.

Speaker: concezio
Dialogue: We gotta take back what's ours with some sincere ironfistery.

Speaker: eunice
Dialogue: Let's explain the glass, now.   Why is most of it inside the room?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: Creative!   It's a creative plan!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: It's ridiculous! Probably based on some stupid shit ya saw in a movie! And here I am AGAIN all tyin' myself up with rope! What is the deal with you and rope?! Honestly!

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: It happens ta be a useful thing!

Speaker: duffy
Dialogue: You didn't get this from a movie...did you?

Speaker: connor
Dialogue: The "Eiger Sanction," Clint Eastwood! And it worked like a fucking charm for him!

Dialogue: O'kay Lloyd Cranston of 135 Liberty Lane, apartment 3C.  Good. Now, I've run into a little snag. I need to figure out a tag line.
